                                            By 
                                                    Sara Solovitch


                                            By 
                                                    Nicholas G. Karambelas


                                            By 
Todd S. Purdum


                                            By 
                                                    Andrea Damewood


                AP Photo

            By 
Shane Goldmacher

09/18/15, 12:42 PM EDT
GREENVILLE, South Carolina – Donald Trump unexpectedly announced Friday that he would skip a major Republican gathering to be held later in the day in South Carolina due to an unidentified “significant business transaction.”
Trump was one of 11 GOP presidential candidates slated to speak at the Heritage Action Presidential Forum at an arena in Greenville. The event is co-sponsored by two of the biggest names in South Carolina GOP politics: Gov. Nikki Haley and former Sen. Jim DeMint. 
Trump’s campaign said his undisclosed transaction “was expected to close Thursday” but a delay made him unable to attend. “He sends his regrets,” the campaign said in a statement. 
Trump spokeswoman Hope Hicks told POLITICO in an email: “It will be announced next week.”
Trump is currently scheduled to be in South Carolina next week to attend a town hall. The Friday forum, held at the Bon Secours Wellness Arena, had promised an audience for Trump of thousands of GOP activists in the key early state. 

2016

            By 
Ben Schreckinger

As the first multi-candidate event following this week’s debate, it had also promised to test his reception against others in the field, most notably Carly Fiorina, whose breakout performance has earned plaudits around the country. 
Ten other Republican hopefuls are still set to address the crowd: Fiorina, Jeb Bush, Ben Carson, Chris Christie, Ted Cruz, Bobby Jindal, Rand Paul, Marco Rubio, Rick Santorum and Scott Walker. 
A spokesman for Heritage Action did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Trump’s last-minute cancellation.
Ben Schreckinger contributed to this report.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Trump bails on Heritage forum in South Carolina
